item.title: Report E-2023090239
item.description:
Report E-2023090239

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-05
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 5, 2023, one (1) 30-liter container of UN3082 was damaged during transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and surfaces beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted surfaces of the trailer and worked them in with hand tools. TLE personnel utilized a plug and patch kit on the eight (8) gallon damaged drum of brake fluid and containerized it into one (1) 35-gallon poly drum as waste. All brake fluid-impacted material was collected and containerized in three (3) 35-gallon poly drums that stayed on-site in Cura's consolidated waste stream.

item.title: Report E-2023090235
item.description:
Report E-2023090235

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-06
  • City: BATTLE CREEK
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 6, 2023, an unknown amount of one (1) gallon pails of paint were damaged while unloading and released approximately thirteen (13) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the impacted surface. SET personnel deployed absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums to be staged onsite for future disposal. Crews secured the scene and demobilized.

item.title: Report E-2023090248
item.description:
Report E-2023090248

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T03:11:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-06
  • City: Easley
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR EXPRESS AMERICA, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 06, 2023, at 1135 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Easley, South Carolina regarding the release of approximately (1) gallon of ORGANIC PEROXIDE TYPE C, LIQUID, TEMPERATURE CONTROLLED (UN3113, 5.2) from (1) 5-gallon Jerrican. Contractors were dispatched to the site to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors were informed by facility personnel that the release was due to a load shift during transit and contained to the trailer floor. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. Facility personnel cleaned and containerized the release prior to contractorsâ€™ arrival and will be responsible for managing the waste.

item.title: Report E-2023090232
item.description:
Report E-2023090232

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T03:11:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-06
  • City: BATTLE CREEK
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 6, 2023, one (1) 330-gallon tote containing UN1805 was damaged due to falling off the lift gate and released approximately eighty (80) gallons of product to the soil. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the impacted site. SET personnel deployed poly sheeting around the impacted areas and patched the one (1) damaged tote. The crew returned the next day to perform a tote transfer. SET personnel conducted a gravity transfer of the remaining material from the damaged tote into one (1) new 330-gallon tote provided by on-site management. Crews deployed a neutralizing agent to the impacted area. Once neutralized, SET personnel utilized a back hoe to remove the impacted soil. The excavated area was backfilled with clean soil, graded to match pre-existing topography, and covered with erosion matting to promote vegetative growth. All impacted soil was collected and containerized into one (1) roll off and staged on-site pending waste profiling for disposal purposes. One (1) background and one (1) confirmation sample were obtained from the site, placed into laboratory approved containers, and transported under chain of custody protocol to the laboratory.

item.title: Report E-2023090195
item.description:
Report E-2023090195

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-01
  • City: ORANGE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 1, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon bucket of acetone was damaged during transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES&H to remediate the impacted site. Crews observed that the released material evaporated prior to their arrival and there was no recoverable material remaining in the trailer. One (1) 5-gallon bucket of product was punctured and released all its contents. No other buckets were damaged and the crew determined it was safe for the driver to continue to his destination. The terminal manager indicated they would offload the freight there and repackage as needed.

item.title: Report E-2023090194
item.description:
Report E-2023090194

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-01
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 1, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1789 was crushed during transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel deployed neutralizing, granular absorbents to the impacted trailer floor and swept them in with hand tools. All freight was wiped down and repalletized for further handling by R+L terminal personnel. All spent absorbents, cleanup debris, and the empty, damaged 5-gallon pail were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drum that was labeled and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPH experienced a UN2922 AB-73 release from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of material released to a 1â€™ x 1â€™ area of the dock floor due to a pinhole puncture. The damaged pail was placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. Spill Fighter was then utilized to neutralize the impacted area. All impacted pads, cardboard, and cleanup debris were containerized into a second 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023090085
item.description:
Report E-2023090085

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-05
  • City: SEAFORD
  • State: DE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XSA experienced a UN1760 Clothesline Fresh BLD 2 release from a 5-gallon poly pail and a Non-Regulated Xcelente release from a 2-liter poly jug. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed all 5-gallons of the UN1760 Clothesline Fresh BLD 2 released as all as all 2-liters of the Xcelente released together. The products impacted a 12â€™ x 4â€™ area of the trailer floor and a 12â€™ x 4â€™ area of the concrete lot below due to forklift punctures. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged empty jugs and spend absorbents were then collected into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023090223
item.description:
Report E-2023090223

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 08-31-23 at 1321 a FRA Inspector in the CSXT Edgewood Yard discovered UTLX645049, a loaded tank car of Crude Sulfate Terpentine leaking vapors from manway. The car was isolated and Georgia-Pacific LLC was notified (CHEMTREC Report #2023083100164). Hepaco LLC, a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the vapors were being released from the manway. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper contact Tom Davidson and 404-376-9550. Contractor personnel opened manway and found that gasket was damaged, Hepaco installed a new manway gasket and tool tightened manway safety bolts. The leak was secured and the car released for transport. This incident did not require a special switching move.

RESPONDER DETERMINED THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING INTERNALLY AND BROUGHT THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP. IT WAS DETERMINED THE BATTERY WAS LEAKING. RESPONDER DISCOVERED THE INTERNAL PACKAGING WAS FORMED FOAM AND A PLASTIC BAG WITH A ZIP TIE. THE ACID HAD LEAKED THROUGH THE PLASTIC BAG.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered by driver on route at around 2:33 P.M. He noticed the outer package was wet and decided to bring it back for further inspection. Upon further inspection, we noticed the cap was loose on the gallon and there was spillage inside the bag leaking through to the box. We used proper safety precautions while cleaning and investigating the damage. DescribePack: Cap on top of the Gallon was loose. There was clear spillage inside the package and a strong odor. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Package was not delivered and brought back to terminal for further inspection.

THEY PLACED THE PACKAGE INTO A LINED TOTE AND BROUGHT IT TO THE HAZ CAGE FOR INSPECTION. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE CONTAINS 12 BOTTLES OF 9 HCL BOWL CLEANER 64OZ WHICH HAD A FEW THAT GOT CRUSHED TOGETHER CAUSING IT TO SPILL OUT INTO THE PACKAGE. AFTER LOOING UP THE SDS FOUND THAT THE ITEMS ARE A FULL CORROSIVE HAZMAT THAT WAS SHIPPED WITH NO MARKINGS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: EVERYTHING WAS PLACED INSIDE A LINED DRUM FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2023090193
item.description:
Report E-2023090193

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: AMARILLO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 30, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured by a forklift and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the concrete surface. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted surface. LSH personnel overpacked the damaged 55-gallon drum in one (1) 85-gallon drum. The crew then deployed granular absorbents to the concrete and swept them in using hand tools. All spent absorbents and clean up debris were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. The crew returned the next day to commence power washing procedures. A boom was deployed to contain the area while crews pressure washed. One hundred and fifty (150) gallons of paint-rinseate were collected into three (3) 55-gallon drums. One (1) drum of spent absorbents, boom, and cleanup debris was also generated as waste. All four (4) 55-gallon drums of waste were staged on-site for further handling by R+L personnel.

item.title: Report E-2023090187
item.description:
Report E-2023090187

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: ANTIOCH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 30, 2023, two (2) one-gallon pails of concrete stain acid (UN1263) were punctured with a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the loading dock floor and adjacent boxes. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew identified the impacted pallet, removed the damaged containers, removed the impacted boxes, and restacked the unaffected cargo. The damaged pails were collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. HES personnel utilized absorbents, absorbent pads, and neutralizer to remediate the impacted areas. The impacted solids were collected with hand tools. All impacted boxes, absorbents, and absorbent pads were collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums. All three (3) drums were labeled and staged onsite for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023090124
item.description:
Report E-2023090124

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-13
  • City: Eureka
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HUNT & SONS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver was distracted trying to pick up spilled soda off of the floor and took his eyes off of the road when his Semi left the right side of the road. When he looked back up he realized that all wheels were off of the road and tried to correct. When his pup was coming back on the highway it rolled over on the drivers side of the pup. Driver continued to try to get control of the rig and dragged the pup for approximately 1/4 mile, spilling fuel the whole way, until the equipment came to a stop on the westbound lane. Upon inspection of the crash site the driver observed several spot fires so he grabbed his 20# extinguisher and attempted to put them out, Shortly after stopping he observed that the tank was on fire so he unhooked his main from the pup and moved the truck down the road. The pup became engulfed in flames and was a total loss as well as the 3500 gal of Diesel fuel. Since that time Hunt and Sons has put on safety meetings at all locations for "Distracted Driving" and are in the process of turning on the in-cab cameras to help coach individuals who become distracted while driving.

item.title: Report E-2023090093
item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: SCHENECTADY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 8/02/2023 an employee at Veolia's Schenectady, NY 10 day intransit facility was loading drums from a trailer into another trailer when the employee scratched the side of a 55-gallon steel drum with the drum cart while placing it in an outbound trailer. The leak occurred when the employee was moving the drums into the trailer and the employee misjudged the clearance to another drum. The 55 gallon drum containing flammable corrosive liquids was scraped with a drum cart which resulted in causing a leak from the drum. Approximately one pint of liquid leaked out of the impacted drum. Liquid was only observed on trailer right below drum and did not leak out of the vehicle. The drum was overpacked into an 85 gallon salvage drum, the spill cleaned up, and transportation to the ultimate disposal facility was continued. The liquid was cleaned up with spill pads and absorbent material. The duration of release is anticipated to be less than 1 minute as the employee immediately noticed the accident and began taking measures to contain the spill.

  • City: RICHMOND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: An employee was offloading a trailer at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Richmond, CA and was staging the drums outside of the trailer prior to receiving the drums to the designated location. He was utilizing a forklift in which he was approaching 4 drums that were palletized. The employee did not realize that the pallet was not a standard size pallet and was not as deep. The forks exceeded the length of the pallet and hit the drum that was on the opposing side. The forks hit the drum roughly an inch above the bottom chime resulting in the drum getting damaged and a small pinhole leak occurred. The overall duration of the incident was a less than 10 minutes and it was determined that approximately 4 to 5 cups of material leaked out. The Veolia employees on site were able to contain the spill and place the damaged drum into a salvage drum.

item.title: Report E-2023090057
item.description:
Report E-2023090057

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-13
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: WORLD FUEL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 8/13/2023, a World Fuel Services, Inc. (WFS) tanker truck and driver were dispatched to the American Heritage vessel located at the Public Landing in downtown Cincinnati, OH for a delivery. The WFS driver arrived on site around 0830 and completed site inspection with vessel personnel, then begin the delivery. At approximately, 0900 the WFS driver saw product leaking from the truckâ€™s pumping equipment and immediately hit the emergency shut off stopping product flow. Five gallons of No. 2 diesel fuel spilled from piping where a gasket had ruptured between the truckâ€™s meter and pump. The spill impacted the concrete parking lot and up to a gallon of diesel impacted the Ohio River at mile marker 469.9. Both WFS and the vessel personnel took action to contained and the cleaned up the spill. The vessel deployed a boom and WFS used spill pads to contained the spill. The WFS driver notified the Cincinnati Operations Manager who then notified the HSSE Manager at 0930. Additional WFS personnel and the Operations Manager were deployed to site with spill cleaned up supplies at this time. And, HEPACO, WFS OSRO, was notified and dispatched to the site. WFS notified the NRC at 0955 of the incident. The Ohio EPA and the Hamilton EMA were notified of the spill between 1008 and 1015. By 1100 the spill had been cleaned up. The spill was cleaned up using absorbent booms, oil dry, and spills pads. Both WFS and vessel personnel cleaned up the spill and HEPACO was called off. The tanker unit was placed out of service until repairs could be completed. WFS later completed the delivery with different equipment, demobilize, and left the site.

Hazmat's needed to be placed on correct unload door in order to avoid issues like this, could cause damages and other issues as well. DescribePack: Box was torn on a corner side, and also wet from spilled bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed inside a hazmat bag inside a plastic bin with absorbent pads.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg unloaded from trailer, package handler noticed wet staining of outer pack. Sent to QA, upon retail inspection found one box with 4 one gallon jugs of Pro-Brown coil cleaner, with one leaking contents. SDS sheet placed with inner package by shipper, sheet states LTD QTY less than 1L. No limited quantity label on outer pack, greater than 1L in package. Inner package has diamond label UN3266. Leaking contents also soaked into other inner package. DescribePack: 4 one gallon jugs in fiberboard box, one gallon jug leaking from cap. Cap is not loose and will not tighten down to stop leaking. Closure failure on the jug cap, inner seal or contact. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package trapped and taken to QA where contents inspected and stood up right so jug stopped leaking. Leaking liquid only soaked into outer pack, did not damage other packages or surroundings.

  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING A PUNGENT ODOR BY A PRIMARY SORTER IN SECTION-A. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE TURNED OFF THE POWER TO THE CONVEYOR BELT, NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR AND EVACUATED THE AREA. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 4 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED, THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA.

item.title: Report X-2023080932
item.description:
Report X-2023080932

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-07
  • City: EDINBURG
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023080932 SequenceEvent: Package was inbound scan at 0435 and left under rollers in the unload. At 5 when QA arrived, they were called to inspect the package in the unload. Upon inspection package was identified to be a HazMat. The cap of the inner item was loose and allowed some of its liquid contents to spill out. Cap was tightened, package was secured in a salvage drum and held at QA to be processed post sort. DescribePack: The inner item is a 2.5-gal plastic container that had a loose cap that allowed some of its liquid contents to spill out wetting the outer package. Top corner of the package is wet and appears to be tearing/coming apart. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As soon as QA was made aware of the damaged item, they quickly responded to identify what the issue was and how to best resolve it. When it was identified as a damaged HazMat a salvage drum and container liner were retrieved to place the package in for safe keeping until it could be processed post sort. 2. X-2023080933 SequenceEvent: Package was inbound scan at 0331 and left under rollers in the unload. At 5 when QA arrived, they were called to inspect the package in the unload. Upon inspection package was identified to be a HazMat. The cap of the inner item was loose and allowed some of its liquid contents to spill out. Cap was tightened, package was secured in a salvage drum and held at QA to be processed post sort. DescribePack: The inner item is a 2.5-gal plastic container that had a loose cap that allowed some of its liquid contents to spill out wetting the outer package. One side of the packaging was completely wet and ripped/torn DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: As soon as QA was made aware of the damaged item, they quickly responded to identify what the issue was and how to best resolve it. When it was identified as a damaged HazMat a salvage drum and container liner were retrieved to place the package in for safe keeping until it could be processed post sort. 3. X-2023080935 SequenceEvent: Package was inbound scan at 0408 and left under rollers in the unload. At 5 when QA arrived, they were called to inspect the package in the unload. Upon inspection package was identified to be a HazMat. The cap of the inner item was loose and allowed some of its liquid contents to spill out. Cap was tightened, package was secured in a salvage drum and held at QA to be processed post sort. DescribePack: As soon as QA was made aware of the damaged item, they quickly responded to identify what the issue was and how to best resolve it. When it was identified as a damaged HazMat a salvage drum and container liner were retrieved to place the package in for safe keeping until it could be processed post sort. Top corner of the package by the FedEx label appears crushed and wet. Side of package has a wet stain and appears to be coming apart. item.title: Report E-2023090096
item.description:
Report E-2023090096

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: MUSKOGEE
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ACTION RESOURCES, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Truck transporting tank trailer load of Nitric Acid was in transit when the driver noticed product leaking from the front portion of the tank onto the rear portion of the truck. Driver pulled over to the shoulder of the road to investigate. Driver discovered a small leak coming from the tank. 911 was called for assistance. The fire department responded and deployed the hazmat team. The roadway was shut down as a precaution. Enviromental response and remediation crew was dispatched to the scene to perform the cleanup, remediation and load transfer onto another tanker. The load was successfully transferred to another tanker and transported to the destination. The cleanup and remediation of the small spill have been completed. The driver accidentally inhaled some nitric fumes before donning his PPE while investigating the problem. He was transported to hospital for treatment. Driver was treated and released. Upon a full inspection of the tank, it was determined that there were some pits in the barrel that caused the leak.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 24, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of sodium hydroxide were damaged and released approximately less than one gallon (<1) of product to the dock floor and adjacent freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew secured the damaged pails in one (1) 55-gallon drum. HCE utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect the released material from the dock floor and adjacent freight. All clean up material was contained in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 24, 2023, four (4) 90-pound boxes of UN2491 were torn and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel utilized hand tools and a neutralizing agent to remediate the site. All spent absorbents and the damaged containers of product were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums to be staged onsite for disposal by R+L.

  • City: ANTIOCH

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 24, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of NA1760 was crushed during a load shift and released approximately thirty (30) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the released material and worked them in using hand tools. The crew overpacked the one (1) damaged 55-gallon drum in one (1) 95-gallon drum. All NA1760-impacted material was containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for terminal disposal.

PES personnel observed the hydrogen peroxide has evaporated. PES personnel over packed the three (3) 5-gallon pails into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All UN2014-impacted waste was staged onsite for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023090004
item.description:
Report E-2023090004

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NKX experienced a UN3105 Norox MCP-75 Red release from a 5-gallon jerrican. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released impacting an 8â€™ x 10â€™ area of the trailer floor and a 10â€™ x 10â€™ area of the concrete lot below due to the pail being crushed as a result of stacking. Oil dri was deployed onto the impacted areas and worked into to clean and remove all free-standing liquid. The damaged empty jug, absorbents, PPE, and spill pads were then collected into a 55-gallon vented poly drum. An impacted pallet was also cut up and placed into a separate 55-gallon vented poly drum. Both drums were submerged with water per XPOâ€™s waste vendor requirements. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LMD experienced a UN1992 CORR21262WR release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of product released impacting a 20â€™ x 20â€™ area of the concrete dock floor and concrete lot below due to a forklift puncture. The salvaged product was transferred into a new tote for shipment on. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 28, 2023, at 0909 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Miami, Florida regarding the release of approximately (3) gallons combined of Tremco PUMA BC (UN1866 Resin Solution, 3, II), Tremco PUMA TC (UN1866 Resin Solution, 3, II), VULKEMÂ® 171 Primer (UN1133, Adhesive, 3, II) from (an unknown amount of) 6-gallon metal drums. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was contained to the trailer floor, the underside of the truck, and a small area of the asphalt under the trailer. All waste generated was containerized in (1) roll-off by contractors which was staged onsite in preparation for proper disposal.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a battery acid release from a 1044-pound UN2794 Battery, filled with acid. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 8-gallons of product released impacting an 8â€™ x 8â€™ area of the trailer floor and a 5â€™ x 3â€™ area of the concrete lot below due to improper loading. The impacted areas were neutralized with sodium bicarbonate and then collected with absorbents. The impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were then containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged battery was shrink wrapped with absorbent pads and secured to a pallet. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: During the unloading phase of trailer, employee was attempting to unload a pallet of freight with a forklift, the forklift blades were protruding past the pallet and punctured two drums in front of the pallet. All spillage of material was confined to immediate area for cleanup.

item.title: Report X-2023081059
item.description:
Report X-2023081059

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-06
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY AN UNLOADER AIN SECTION-B, DOOR 19. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG SHE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HER IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 1 MINUTE A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION BY RESPONDER REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 2 POLY 1-GALLON JUG WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE BASE OF THE CARTON. THE INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF CORRUGATED PARTITIONS AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet. Package came off of trailer# 454830 already damaged/leaking. Upon inspection of inner contents 4 X 1 gallon plastic bottles of wave solder flux. 1 gallon plastic bottle of wave solder flux had a loose cap allowing .10 gallons to release. The other 3 X 1 gallon plastic bottles of wave solder flux were not damaged. There were slotted partitions but no absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed. Contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1 gallon plastic bottle of wave solder flux had a loose cap leaking out .10 gallons of wave solder flux. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a hazmat bag lined red tote.

  • Description: 1. X-2023080856 SequenceEvent: The package was found with a wet cap and QA was informed that it was leaking. The package was properly placed in a red hazmat bin with the proper liner during overnight shift. I QA was also informed that one of the package handlers noted that the liquid from the hazmat caused a minor chemical burn that did not need hospitalization. The manager noted the injury and reported it accordingly. DescribePack: The package failure was due to the vent on the cap. The package was not placed in its correct orientation which caused this vent to leak. The cap itself was closed tightly. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The plastic pail was placed upright in it correct orientation. 2. X-2023080857 SequenceEvent: The package was taken out of the trailer with a wet cap. QA was informed that the package was leaking. The package was discovered by QA by 3:30 a.m. DescribePack: The package failure was due to a vented lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bucket was placed upright in its correct orientation.

  • City: HUNKER
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During transpiration back to the station, the bucket tipped over and rolled inside the truck, striking a bolt causing the perfect circle puncture. With some spillage in truck (Unknow cleanup). Upon arriving to work to check our VSA cart which drivers leave packages that are marked for QA service, I noticed a hazmat bucket lying on it side. Further investigating I saw a small hole at the bottom of the plastic pail. I placed a red hazmat bin on top on the bucket to prevent other packages being placed around it. Procced to acquire a yellow barrel, hazmat bags, gloves, inner stuffing and, absorb pads. Placed gloves on hands and placed absorb pads around leakage on the VSA cart, lifted plastic drum into red hazmat bin for processing, processed and placed into yellow drum with inner fillings and into hazmat cage. DescribePack: Small screw sized hold 1/2 inch from bottom of drum. inward puncture DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: drum was placed on side, using absorb pad and tape to prevent excess spillage during transportation.

item.title: Report X-2023080836
item.description:
Report X-2023080836

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING ON OUR LOADING DOCK. IT WAS IN AN UNMARKED BOX THAT HAD BEEN REPACKED BY ANOTHER STATION WHO FAILED TO ADD ANY UP ARROWS OR DIAMOND LABELS ONTO THE PACKAGE. THEY DID TAPE THE OP-900 TO THE PACKAGE. THE ADMIN PLACED THE PACKAGE INTO A LINED TOTE AND BROUGH IT TO THE HAZ CAGE FOR INSPECTION. THEY ALSO FAILED TO RELABEL THE PACKAGE THEY JUST REPACKED IT INTO AN UNMARKED BOX AND TRIED TO SEND IT FORWARD. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS WAY TO BIG FOR JUST THE THREE ITEMS THAT WERE LOOSE INSIDE OF IT. NORMALLY THESE PACKAGES CONTAIN FOUR BOTTLES NOT JUST THREE. WHICH LEADS ME TO BELIEVE SINCE IT WAS REPACKED IF THE MISSING BOTTLE MAY OF BEEN DAMAGED. ONE OF THE ITEMS INSIDE THE PACKAGE DID OPEN FROM THE LID CAUSING IT TO SPILL OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE DAMAGED ITEM WAS PLACED INSIDE A LINED DRUM FOR PROCESSING. THE LAST TWO UNDAMGED ITEMS HAVE BEEN PROPERLY REPACKED SO THEY MAY BE RTS.

item.title: Report I-2023080043
item.description:
Report I-2023080043

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T03:11:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: Boston
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Flight 382, the passenger came into the aft galley wanting to dispose of what looked like tissue in her hand. The Flight Attendant opened the lid of the trash cart so she could throw it in. The Flight Attendant caught the sight of a light purple color. She asked the passenger about it and she mentioned it was a Vape. The Flight Attendant said,"A Vape?" and she said yes. Flight Attendant called the Captain and explained what had happened. She then tells me it was warm. Flight Attendant tells the passenger"We need to take it out of the trash cart now", which we did. Flight Attendant calls the Capt back and told him the Vape was warm and if he wants me to put it in a bucket of ice water. He instructs me to place it in the fire containment bag. Flight Attendant followed the procedures for this and placed it in a cart. The passenger and Flight Attendant walked out of the aircraft together and the Flight Attendant handed the bag to the Agent. The Flight Attendant was very grateful the passenger did not throw the item in the Iavatory trash container. Note: Overheating Vape was a Iceberry Lemon Flum Float vape.

  • Description: On 07/14/2023 at approxiamtely 1215, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 658069 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting an declared toxic shipment. The shipment conststed of 5 overpackaed pallets, covered in white shrinkwrap. The shrinkwrap on one of the pallets torn for an unknown reason, revealing a package that was marked "UN 3249" and labeled with a 6.1 hazard label. This overpacked pallet contained hidden dangerous goods. Dangerous Goods Administration instructed the location to hold the shipment for further investigation; however, miscommunications lead to the shipment proceeding in transmit internationally, along with the other 4 overpacked pallets. Dangerous Goods Adminstrition has instructed the team to hold the shipment for furhter investigation.

  • Description: Part of a multi piece shipment, package was offered to a spill cleanup specialist at the Memphis Hub when staining indicated package was leaking. Package was seen to be in a fibreboard box. It was reported inside the fibreboard box there were 2 plastic jugs each containing 1 L of UN1245, Methyl Isobutyl Ketone. During further investigation found a cap on one of the jugs was not tightly secured on the bottle and allowed for an estimated .125L to escape. Styrofoam peanuts were used for dunnage. There was no positive closure noted on the jugs. Contents of the package were placed in a steel salvage drum and shipper contacted for amened shipper's declaration for continued travel.

  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=589295704649 PHY STATE=No Release TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1170 CLASS=30 PSN TEXT=ETHANOL SOLUTION PKG GRP=III )Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=589295704660 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=No Release TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1170 CLASS=30 PSN TEXT=ETHANOL SOLUTION PKG GRP=III )Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=589295704671 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=No Release TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1170 CLASS=30 PSN TEXT=ETHANOL SOLUTION PKG GRP=III )Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=589295704693 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=No Release TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1170 CLASS=30 PSN TEXT=ETHANOL SOLUTION PKG GRP=III )On July 30th 6 jerricans containing UN1170, ETHANOL SOLUTION, 3, III were found to be compromised. Two of the jerricans leaked some of the liquid contained inside, and the other four only had an odor. We are unable to determine the source of the leak on the two jerricans. All were placed into salvage drums and are awaiting disposition and amended shippers declarations if necessary, from the shipper.

  • City: LONGVIEW
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PLAINS MARKETING LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 1
  • Description: On July 2, 2023 at approximately 7:15 PM, a Plains transport driver with a load of crude oil was traveling southbound on State Highway 42 in Gregg County, TX. At the intersection of Hwy 42 and Texaco Rd, a 2012 Nissan traveling east on Texaco Rd failed to stop at a stop sign and collided with Plains transport, causing the tank trailer to separate from the tractor and roll over into the ditch. Upon separation, the landing gear broke off and punctured a 3x3 inch hole in the trailer, at the 7 o'clock position if upright, but upon roll over, puncture was located at the 10 o'clock position. As a result of the collision, 70 gallons of diesel from the transport fuel tank and approximately 2 gallons of hydraulic fluid, from the trailer hydraulic pump and lines, were released to the roadway and roadside ditch. The Plains vehicle and the other vehicle were non drivable and had to be towed from the scene. An absorbent was applied to the roadway to encapsulate the diesel and hydraulic fluid, then swept and contained in 55 gallon drums. The impacted roadside ditch has been excavated to remove impacted soil and manifested for disposal, in accordance with TCEQ clean-up criteria. . . The Plains employee was injured and treated at a medical facility. Occupant of other vehicle perished at the scene.

The remediation work is complete pending final sample analysis and report.

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: WESTOVER
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: C THREE LOGISTICS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 2
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 7-11-23: At approx 2100 hrs, in Morgantown WV our truck / trailer carrying UN,2312, Phenol, Molten, 6.1, II was flagged down. A mist from the top of the tanker trailer had landed on a car following our TT; Due to the HM product, EMS was activated. Fire, Police and HM responded. There was an light odor of the product in the air. A check of a valve at the top of the tanker revealed that hit was not fully closed. The driver had performed a pre trip inspection and the valve was closed at that time. No product was exiting the tank at this time. The product, which is not under pressure, would only be able to exit that valve while ascending or descending inclines. On flat ground the productÂ· would not be able to be released. The valve was secured by HM Responders. The tanker was allowed to complete the remainder of the trip ( Approx 1/2 mile) to be unloaded. Two passerbys claimed to be affected by the product. They were transported to a local hospital for observations, then released. C Three Logistics has contracted with a HM response cleanup operation to properly decontaminate the exterior of the affected motor vehicle.

item.title: Report X-2023080915
item.description:
Report X-2023080915

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: JONESBORO
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat pkg was on a closure cart in the middle area by our chutes where the closures and misloads go. I had checked on the package earlier to see where it needed to go, and did not see any leaking around the package. Someone had grabbed the cart that the package was on, and put it on the rollers attached to the chute, and about 30 minutes later, I heard the manager call out that there was a leaking Hazmat. I ran over to the area, and the manager, a PH, and another QA were picking up the leaking, corrosive Hazmat with their bare hands, putting it into a tote, and making the package leak everywhere. I immediately told them to set the package down and to clear the area. I let them know that it was a corrosive liquid and that it could burn them. They had already set it on the tugger, and it was leaking all over the back of the tugger as well. They set it down, and I grabbed it, and put it on my QA cart. When I set it on the cart, the liquid splashed up on my arms and on my left leg (as I was wearing shorts), and it started burning my skin. I told them to immediately clear the area, go rinse their hands, and I took my cart to the QA area, and hurried to the Hazmat shower to start rinsing my arms and leg off. After I had rinsed off for about 8 to 10 mins, I then went back and got the tugger that had been leaked on, and took it to the QA area to put it out of order. I then took my QA cart to the Hazmat cage and put the damaged portion of the package into a lined salvage drum. DescribePack: Package failed due to a loose cap on one of the bottles of Warewashing Detergents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I went to the spill area, and put the chemical neutralizer onto the spilled liquid and then put the shredded absorbing material onto it as well. I put caution tape over the area, and the next morning, I pH tested several spots, as well as the spots on the tugger, and then put down more neutralizer as needed. I then waited until about 11:00a that morning to sweep up the neutralizer and absorbing material into a hazardous material bag, and place it into the salvage drum with the other damaged portion of the damaged package.

FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE, THE RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE LEAKER FOLLOWING THE APPRIATE STEPS. THE RESPONDER BROUGHT THE LEAKER BACK TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: A bag containing aerosol cans was damaged coming down the flex slide. Upon inspection, it was discovered that two of the cans had discharged. The bag was quickly taken to the HMPA. DescribePack: The cap was broken completely off of one can. The other had been compressed enough to discharge some contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was quickly taken to the HMPA, where it was placed in a lined tote. Spillage was confined to the inside of the padded mailer.

item.title: Report I-2023070017
item.description:
Report I-2023070017

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-16T00:32:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-16
  • City: Denver
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 3
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: As flight 663(DEN-MEM) departed DEN and after passing flight level 100, a passengers lithium batteries went into thermal runaway. The batteries exited the passengers carryon bag and shrapnel from the explosion hit a few other passengers which caused some minor burns. The flight crew extinguished and cooled the batteries and placed them in the onboard containment bag. The aircraft diverted back to DEN where the batteries were removed and first aid was administered to the passengers. Passenger had the 18650 batteries in his carryon bag and installed in a charging cradle.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hilco Transport Company picked up a shipment of liquid asphalt at the Associated Asphalt terminal in Inman, SC. While travelling on US Hwy 176, a boil-over of the material occurred, resulting in the release of an estimated 75 gallons of liquid asphalt to the paved road surface. The material did not impact soil and/or surface water systems or surface water bodies. The liquid asphalt was stabilized using sand, then allowed to cool. After cooling, the asphalt material was recovered and transported for recycling.

  • Description: The back gate of a parked dump trailer was partially opened to check for the presence of a liner. The operator was unaware that the trailer contained waste materials. After opening, waste materials were released from the gate onto the parking lot. The gate was closed with assistance of a fork truck, which stopped the release. Released materials were cleaned up promptly using onsite resources and placed into containers for subsequent management.

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-19
  • City: NORTHBROOK
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE MARKED AS UN3373 BIOLOGICAL SUBSTANCE, CATEGORY B WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING A RED SUBSTANCE AT THE UPS FACILITY IN NORTHBROOK, ILLINOIS. UPON INSPECTION THERE WAS AN UNFROZEN VASCULAR TISSUE SAMPLE THAT WAS CONTAINED IN A PLASTIC BAG NOT FULLY SEALED. THE PARTIALLY SEALED BAG WAS CONTAINED WITHIN A STYROFOAM INSULATING BOX ALONG WITH ONE ICE PACK ON THE BOTTOM. THE STYROFOAM LID WAS NOT FULLY CLOSED AND A WATERY RED LIQUID HAD LEAKED FROM THE PARTIALLY OPENED LID. THE OUTER CARTON WAS WET AND STAINED AN ORANGE-RED COLOR. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM VETERINARY SPECIALTY CENTER, 2501 WAUKEGAN RD, BANNOCKBURN, IL 60015 USING UPS ACCOUNT 642677, U OF I DIAGNOSTIC LAB, 20015 S LINCOLN, URBANA, IL 61802. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2023061322
item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: STOCKTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 2023 06 21 this HAZMAT shipment was observed leaking during deramping at that Stockton Intermodal Facility. Unit was placed in the hazpit for safekeeping until remediation was complete. Hazmat One was notified and they dispatched Patriot Environmental to inspect and remediate. Contractor arrived on property at approximately 13:00 to begin remediation. Upon exterior inspection, contractor observed a liquid, with a strong odor leaking at a rate of 4 5 drops per minute from the rear right corner of the trailer. Leaking liquid appears to be evaporating shortly after hitting the ground. Once door was opened, contractor observed a shipment of mixed freight, which included two pallets of metal drums loaded at the rear. Both pallets shifted toward the door, coming to rest against a load bar, which caused damage to four drums (two of which are leaking and identified in attached photos). It is estimated that a total of 2 quarts of product leaked from two drums. Product is identified as UN1247 // METHYL METHACRYLATE MONOMER, STABILIZED.

item.title: Report E-2023060386
item.description:
Report E-2023060386

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-16T00:32:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-06
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CIRCLE K
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 1
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 06, 2023, at 0150ET, Circle K reported 9,000-gallons of gasoline released from a 9,003-gallon tanker trailer impacting the asphalt roadway, soil, gravel and a nearby storm drain due to being involved in a multi-vehicle accident. No waterways were impacted. A utility pole was also impacted. The tanker was rear-ended causing the saddle tanks to release the product, as a result the tanker caught fire. The driver reportedly passed away and the roadway was closed. The fire department put out the fire with foam. On May 06, 2023, at 0720 ET, HEPACO arrived onsite to clean up the remaining impact and debris. HEPACO replaced the damaged power pole and flushed the impacted drain with 800-gallons of water. The soil area was excavated and boom was deployed at the drain. HEPACO collected and containerized 1,700 gallons of liquid into a vacuum truck and (2) 55-gallons metal drums of gasoline impacted rags.

item.title: Report I-2023070044
item.description:
Report I-2023070044

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-16T00:32:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-15
  • City: LAURENS
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FREEHOLD CARTAGE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver and technician were transferring drum from pallet onto trailer floor when It suddenly cracked, causing contents of drum to spill out. The liquid spilled onto concrete and trace amounts impacted storm drain. Generator responded immediately to mitigate spill and potential environmental cleanup. Pigs were placed around storm drain which prevented most of the liquid from entering storm drain which helped isolate further cleanup and liquid run off. Acid absorbent material and lime were used to soak up remaining liquid. The PPE and contents of cleanup were placed ln over pack drum and transported to TSDF as required. After Inspection grounds it was determined no liquid was visibility detected in outfall nor did It Impact round soil. Under the advisement from South Carolina Department of Health and Enviromental (SCDHEC) llme was dispensed into storm drain as added precaution. In addition, quarterly storm-water was recommended to assure no further contamination occurred.

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-27
  • City: KEENESBURG

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PLAINS MARKETING, L.P.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 4/27/2023, at approximately 07:30, a Plains transport driver with a load of crude oil was traveling westbound on Highway 52. At the intersection of Highway 52 and WCR 65, a Weld County SD school bus pulled out into the westbound lane of travel of Highway 52 from WCR 65. The Plains transport unit collided with the front passenger side portion of the school bus. The Plains employee was injured and treated at a medical facility, and a Non-DOT D&A test was completed when medically released. No injuries to the passengers or driver of the school bus were reported from the occupants. As a result of the collision, the Plains transport released approximately 30 barrels of crude oil contained on-site. The Plains company vehicle and the Weld County SD school bus were non-drivable and had to be towed from the scene.
